sense.name: A heading that names a statute or legislative bill.
sense.examples: Title 8 provided federal help for schools. Colleges must comply with Title 9.

sense.name: The name of a piece of work.
sense.examples: He looked for books with long titles. The novel had chapter titles. He never gives his paintings titles.

sense.name: The status of being champion.
sense.examples: He held the title for two years. Who will get the boxing title this year?

sense.name: A physical legal document giving rights to some property.
sense.examples: He signed the title. He kept the title to his car in the glove compartment.

sense.name: An identifying appellation signifying status or function.
sense.examples: The professor didn't like his friends to use the formal title. What is the appropriate title for the Queen?

sense.name: An established or recognized right, formal or informal.
sense.examples: He has title to any of his father's property. He staked his title. That will be his title to fame.

sense.name: (usually plural) written material introduced into a movie or tv show to give credits, represent dialogue, or explain an action.
sense.examples: The titles go by faster than I can read them. This movie has many titles in the first few minutes.
